description: Common side effects often associated with chemotherapy and radiation therapy, which can be managed with medication and dietary changes.
Persistent tiredness or lack of energy, commonly experienced by cancer patients undergoing treatment.
The loss of hair from the scalp or other parts of the body due to chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
Painful sores or ulcers that may develop in the mouth or throat as a side effect of cancer treatment.
Frequent, loose, or watery bowel movements that can occur as a side effect of chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
A reduction in the number of white blood cells, which increases the risk of infections.
Nerve damage that can cause tingling, numbness, or pain in the hands and feet, often associated with certain chemotherapy drugs.
Build-up of excess fluid in the body, leading to swelling or edema, which may occur as a side effect of cancer treatment.
Changes in the appearance or texture of the nails, such as discoloration, brittleness, or ridges, often associated with chemotherapy.
